Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Remote Ischemic Preconditioning and Anesthetic-Induced Preconditioning in Rabbit Hearts

Trial_Design.evidence: In a randomised controlled trial, 24 male New Zealand White rabbits were allocated to four groups

Participants.evidence: 24 male New Zealand White rabbits were allocated to four groups

Intervention.evidence: The rIPC group underwent four cycles of 5-minute hind limb ischemia and reperfusion. The APC group received 2.5 vol% sevoflurane for 20 minutes, followed by a 20-minute washout.

Objective.evidence: This study investigates their combined effect on myocardial protection.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was myocardial infarction size after 30 minutes of global ischemia and 2 hours of reperfusion, assessed using TTC staining.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 24 male New Zealand White rabbits were allocated to four groups

Result_Outcome.evidence: Both rIPC and APC significantly reduced myocardial infarction size by over 50% compared to controls (rIPC: 12.1±1.7%; APC: 13.5±2.1%; control: 31.3±3.0%; P<0.01).
